zone.line: In the 1st place the word Gk: atheos does not mean atheist. It's literal
translation is "godless" and its accepted meaning among the Greeks
was "an impious person". - it was a mere term of reproach &
revilement. Atheist on the contrary expresses a person who
denies certain opinions concerning the cause of the Universe. It
expresses neither blame nor praise but simply defines an opinion
Thus all those persons who deny that this great system
one

same manner as we percieve other thinking agents arrange
such portions of it as are submitted to their power, are
called Atheists. All the Greek philosophers until the
time of Anaximander were in this sense Atheists — Very many
afterwards held opinions within this definition. Aristotle can
hardly be called a Theist. Epicurus was Diogenes, Theodorus
